Package core

Class Curve2.Knot2

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Curve2.Knot2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Curve2.Knot2>
    Enclosing class:
    Curve2
    public static class Curve2.Knot2
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Curve2.Knot2>
    Groups together vectors which shape a Bezier curve into a coordinate (or anchor point), fore handle (the following control point) and rear handle (the preceding control point).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      Vec2 coord
      The spatial coordinate of the knot.
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_STRING_FORMAT
      The knot's default string format.
      Vec2 foreHandle
      The handle which warps the curve segment heading away from the knot along the direction of the curve.
      Vec2 rearHandle
      The handle which warps the curve segment heading towards the knot along the direction of the curve.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Knot2()
      The default constructor.
      Knot2​(float xCoord, float yCoord)
      Creates a knot from a coordinate
      Knot2​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float xFore, float yFore, float xRear, float yRear)
      Creates a knot from real numbers.
      Knot2​(Curve2.Knot2 source)
      Creates a knot from a source knot.
      Knot2​(Vec2 coord, Vec2 foreHandle, Vec2 rearHandle)
      Creates a knot from a series of vectors.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Curve2.Knot2 alignHandles​(Vec2 foreDir, Vec2 rearDir, Vec2 foreScaled)
      Aligns this knot's handles in the same direction while preserving their magnitude.
      Curve2.Knot2 alignHandlesBackward​(Vec2 foreDir, Vec2 rearDir, Vec2 foreScaled)
      Aligns this knot's fore handle to its rear handle while preserving magnitude.
      Curve2.Knot2 alignHandlesForward​(Vec2 rearDir, Vec2 foreDir, Vec2 rearScaled)
      Aligns this knot's rear handle to its fore handle while preserving magnitude.
      Curve2.Knot2 clone()
      Creates a new knot with the coordinate and handles of this knot.
      int compareTo​(Curve2.Knot2 knot)
      Compares this knot to another based on a comparison between coordinates.
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Tests to see if this knot equals an object
      static Curve2.Knot2 fromPolar​(float angle, float radius, float handleMag, Curve2.Knot2 target, Vec2 temp0, Vec2 temp1)
      Creates a knot from polar coordinates, where the knot's forehandle is tangent to the radius.
      static java.lang.String getStringFormat()
      Gets the format for the string representation of this knot.
      int hashCode()
      Returns the knot's hash code based on those of its three constituent vectors.
      Curve2.Knot2 mirrorHandles​(Vec2 temp)
      Mirrors this knot's handles.
      Curve2.Knot2 mirrorHandlesBackward​(Vec2 temp)
      Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear.
      Curve2.Knot2 mirrorHandlesForward​(Vec2 temp)
      Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore.
      Curve2.Knot2 reverse​(Vec2 temp)
      Reverses the knot's direction by swapping the fore- and rear-handles.
      Curve2.Knot2 rotateZ​(float radians)
      Rotates this knot around the z axis by an angle in radians.
      Curve2.Knot2 scale​(float scale)
      Scales this knot by a factor.
      Curve2.Knot2 scale​(Vec2 scale)
      Scales this knot by a non-uniform scalar.
      Curve2.Knot2 set​(float xCoord, float yCoord)
      Sets the coordinate, fore and rear handles to the input coordinate.
      Curve2.Knot2 set​(float xCoord, float yCoord, float xFore, float yFore, float xRear, float yRear)
      Sets the knot's coordinate, forehandle and rearhandle by component.
      Curve2.Knot2 set​(Curve2.Knot2 source)
      Sets this knot from a source knot.
      Curve2.Knot2 set​(Vec2 coord, Vec2 foreHandle, Vec2 rearHandle)
      Sets this knot from a series of vectors.
      static void setStringFormat​(java.lang.String stringFormat)
      Sets the format for the string representation of the knot.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this knot.
      Curve2.Knot2 translate​(Vec2 v)
      Translates this knot by a vector.

    • Method Detail

      • fromPolar

        public static Curve2.Knot2 fromPolar​(float angle,
                                     float radius,
                                     float handleMag,
                                     Curve2.Knot2 target,
                                     Vec2 temp0,
                                     Vec2 temp1)
        Creates a knot from polar coordinates, where the knot's forehandle is tangent to the radius.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle in radians
        radius - the radius
        handleMag - the magnitude of the handles
        target - the output knot
        temp0 - temporary vector 1
        temp1 - temporary vector 2
        Returns:
        the knot
        See Also:
        Vec2.mult(Vec2, float, Vec2), Vec2.negate(Vec2, Vec2), Vec2.add(Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

      • mirrorHandles

        public Curve2.Knot2 mirrorHandles​(Vec2 temp)
        Mirrors this knot's handles. Defaults to mirroring in the forward direction.
        Parameters:
        temp - a temporary vector
        Returns:
        this knot

      • mirrorHandlesBackward

        public Curve2.Knot2 mirrorHandlesBackward​(Vec2 temp)
        Sets the forward-facing handle to mirror the rear-facing handle: the fore will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the rear. A temporary vector is required for the swap.
        Parameters:
        temp - a temp vector
        Returns:
        the knot

      • mirrorHandlesForward

        public Curve2.Knot2 mirrorHandlesForward​(Vec2 temp)
        Sets the rear-facing handle to mirror the forward-facing handle: the rear will have the same magnitude and negated direction of the fore. A temporary vector is required for the swap.
        Parameters:
        temp - a temp vector
        Returns:
        the knot

      • reverse

        public Curve2.Knot2 reverse​(Vec2 temp)

        Parameters:
        temp - a temporary vector
        Returns:
        this knot
